summary: Rati spent his day wrestling GSIP’s multi-GPU setups into submission, squashing device selection bugs and fine-tuning ZOR calculations. He even found time to polish benchmarks—all in a productive, 200-plus line shift.
Rati beefed up GSIP today, adding 130+ lines to ensure his benchmark generation is fully configured and comprehensive. He’s clearly not leaving any performance metrics to chance.
Rati went on a 4,000-line tear today, slashing GSIP’s RAM usage by 4x and shipping a new GTK GUI. He even found time to polish his portfolio between those massive architectural overhauls.
Rati finalized and committed his significant initial investigation report for `rasdaman-mcp`, churning 359 lines of analysis to officially close out the project’s first major milestone.
Rati tackled the tedious but necessary task of updating his GitHub profile, ensuring his academic status and showcased project links were sharp and finally badge-free.

Rati’s busy perfecting kickstart.nvim, adding over 650 lines to unify his AI setup while silencing noisy Python diagnostics. He's clearly prioritizing a cleaner, smarter workflow with that substantial code refresh.
Rati delivered a colossal architectural overhaul to AIRA, migrating memory to ChromaDB and SQLite while adding system-wide theming and Linux file manager hooks in a nearly 2,000-line push.
